metadata.Title: CVE-2021-26272 on Ubuntu 22.10 (kinetic) - medium.
metadata.Description:
It was possible to execute a ReDoS-type attack inside CKEditor 4 before 4.16 by persuading a victim to paste crafted URL-like text into the editor, and then press Enter or Space (in the Autolink plugin).

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-26272` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

ckeditor - 4.16.2+dfsg-1
No subscription required

notes.Note: litios> No specific patch was found

criterions.comment: ckeditor package in kinetic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.16.2+dfsg-1').
